title: ScamViruS
author: ScamViruS
created_time: August 12, 2022, 10:26:58 PMLast edit: August 13, 2022, 04:42:28 AM by ScamViruS
content: What happened: Fake gambling website.  Website:  Code:https://www.bingo-hash.com/h5.html#/Every day, scammers send messages with various offers using different mediums including Telegram. They create fake gambling websites and try to scam crypto users with tempting offers. Experienced users ignore these offers, but inexperienced crypto users fall into such traps, due to which scammers are constantly creating these fake websites.QuoteDomain Name: bingo-hash.comRegistry Domain ID: 2688438446_DOMAIN_COM-VRSNRegistrar WHOIS Server: whois.godaddy.comRegistrar URL: https://www.godaddy.comUpdated Date: 2022-04-11T08:26:11ZCreation Date: 2022-04-11T08:26:10ZRegistrar Registration Expiration Date: 2023-04-11T08:26:10ZRegistrar: GoDaddy.com, LLCRegistrar IANA ID: 146Registrar Abuse Contact Email: email@godaddy.comRegistrar Abuse Contact Phone: +1.4806242505

comments.author: ScamViruS
comments.body: They start the conversation like this and try their best to convince you that they are the real website. So any gambler who follows the steps shown by them will end up falling victim to the scam. So, if you get such a message, you should be extra careful to avoid falling prey to scams.

comments.author: fortunecrypto
comments.body: I never sign up to casinos that do guerilla marketing, they are very deceptive and these are the kind of casinos that we can call fly-by-night casinos once they victimize enough people they will shut down, I Google this casino to extract more information and this is what I see on one site https://www.scamdoc.com/view/990169 it has a very bad trust rating QuoteVery bad trust indexWarning, only for experienced users!

comments.author: logfiles
comments.body: Quote from: ScamViruS on August 13, 2022, 12:02:58 PMThey start the conversation like this and try their best to convince you that they are the real website.Scammers everywhere, especially on Telegram. Imagine someone messaging you about gambling, as if they even know if you gamble. I usually get random strangers sending me texts on my telegram, but I don't even give them any chance to tell me any of their scam nonsense, as I just report and mark their accounts as spammy ones. Telegram probably bans them multiple times.

comments.author: ScamViruS
comments.body: Quote from: logfiles on August 14, 2022, 07:23:19 PMQuote from: ScamViruS on August 13, 2022, 12:02:58 PMThey start the conversation like this and try their best to convince you that they are the real website.Scammers everywhere, especially on Telegram. Imagine someone messaging you about gambling, as if they even know if you gamble. I usually get random strangers sending me texts on my telegram, but I don't even give them any chance to tell me any of their scam nonsense, as I just report and mark their accounts as spammy ones. Telegram probably bans them multiple times.After you join any Big telegram group you will get various offers messages. And all those messages are intended to lure you into a tempting trap and scam you.When I receive a message and know that it is intended to scam me, I continue the conversation with them to find out their main motive. Because if I get the link of that website and expose that website then gamblers can stay away from this kind of scam. If you receive such messages, it is safe to mark them as spam and block them.

comments.author: khaled0111
comments.body: A gambling website promising a stable income, that's a first! On top of that they will assign you a personal instructor!Does this really work? I mean how can anyone be so naive to fall for this?Quote from: ScamViruS on August 14, 2022, 08:58:43 PMAfter you join any Big telegram group you will get various offers messages. And all those messages are intended to lure you into a tempting trap and scam you.This is one of the many downsides of using telegram. If your account is set as public, which is the default setting, anyone can find you and start sending you unsolicited messages.

comments.author: FatFork
comments.body: Quote from: khaled0111 on August 14, 2022, 10:12:45 PMA gambling website promising a stable income, that's a first! On top of that they will assign you a personal instructor!Does this really work? I mean how can anyone be so naive to fall for this?I also hope that anyone reading this will never fall for a scam like this. Unfortunately, statistics have proven that there are always people who are gullible enough to fall for it. All we can do is warn people of these scams, to prevent them from losing their money.The truth is that there is no such thing as a stable income in gambling! It's either you win or lose. If you want to make money, then do something else.

comments.author: stompix
comments.created_time: August 15, 2022, 12:47:49 PMLast edit: May 20, 2023, 07:32:13 PM by stompix
comments.body: Anyone here has the guts to test if this is real?  I'm willing to bet the moment they get 5k they close shop and disappear.Anyhow, not only is this the first casino that promotes stable and guaranteed income but what the hell is with the website design if I access the link in the desktop I see only one banner if I go directly to the root I'm redirected to an unscrollable pc.html page, was this shit design only for mobile?Interesting that they told you what the equivalenting INR gain is, despite you ignoring the where are you from the question but how does 1800INR equal $1500? And how does $100 a day make you $1500 a month? Quote from: khaled0111 on August 14, 2022, 10:12:45 PMThis is one of the many downsides of using telegram.If your account is set as public, which is the default setting, anyone can find you and start sending you unsolicited messages. That's the reason I only use telegram to tell people to contact me over WhatsApp
